p: Recently, the interest of researchers in exploring the antiparasitic properties of ethnoveterinary medicinal plants is increasing and this field of research is inundated with ethnopharmacological studies. This review is aimed to gather fragmented literature about the; (a) efficacy of different plants against H. contortus by in vitro and in vivo proof; (b) toxicology, mechanism of action, and active phyto-compounds involve in anti-haemonchiasis activity; (c) and comparative analysis of plant species evaluated both in vitro and in vivo. Moreover, the study also highlights existing knowledge gaps in the present research and provides future recommendations to fulfill those gaps.
